poem:
### Drought in England

parched fields  
a landscape aching  
with thirst—  
the hushed whispers  
of streams  
dry up in the sun  

farmers, like pages  
crinkling under heat,  
crave rain's forgotten promise—

rationed dreams,  
a land divided  
by cracked earth  
awaiting tender  
showers  
that will not come
